review: If you already have a wi-fi enabled TV, this doesn't necessarily add much.Although the product description says, "Send video, music or anything from the Web to your TV from your smartphone, tablet or laptop," when it comes to "anything from the web," it's more like "from a tiny slice of the web" if you want to use this with an Android tablet/phone.The Android tablet/phone options aren't browser-based. So, you can choose from about two dozen Android apps to cast with (as of May, 2014). It's more than my tv, but I have a modern tv, so the additions aren't anything I was missing. You cannot yet use Chrome on your tablet to cast using Chromecast.So you have to use Chrome on a computer to cast "anything on the web." It decreases the convenience quite a bit, and in my case, it made my Macbook Pro run over-the-top hot. Way hotter than when I just stream video and watch it on the laptop screen.When it is well-integrated with the Android version of Chrome, it will be great. But not yet.
